HTMLButtonElement.summary: The HTMLButtonElement interface provides properties and methods (beyond the regular interface it also has available to it by inheritance) for manipulating {{HTMLElement("button")}} elements.

remarks.para: -HTML element implementing this interface: button

HTMLButtonElementCheckValidity.summary: The checkValidity() method of the interface returns a boolean value which indicates if the element meets any constraint validation rules applied to it. If false, the method also fires an event on the element. Because there's no default browser behavior for checkValidity(), canceling this invalid event has no effect. It always returns true if the {{HTMLElement("button")}} element's is "button" or "reset", because such buttons are never candidates for constraint validation.

blockquote.para: An HTML button element of the "submit" type with a non-null is considered invalid, will match the CSS {{cssxref(":invalid")}} pseudo-class, and will cause checkValidity() to return false. Use the method to set the to the empty string to set the state to be valid.

remarks.para:
-
-button
-form
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
-CSS :valid and :invalid pseudo-classes

HTMLButtonElementCheckValidity.returns: Returns true if the element's value has no validity problems; otherwise, returns false.

HTMLButtonElementCommand.summary: The command property of the interface gets and sets the action to be performed on an element being controlled by this button. For this to have an effect, commandfor must be set.

remarks.para: It reflects the command HTML attribute.

HTMLButtonElementCommand.value: A string. See the command attribute for valid values.

HTMLButtonElementCommandForElement.summary: The commandForElement property of the interface gets and sets the element to control via a button.

remarks.para: It is the JavaScript equivalent of the commandfor HTML attribute.

HTMLButtonElementCommandForElement.value: A reference to an existing that the button controls.

HTMLButtonElementDisabled.summary: The HTMLButtonElement.disabled property indicates whether the control is disabled, meaning that it does not accept any clicks.

HTMLButtonElementForm.summary: The form read-only property of the interface returns an object that owns this {{htmlelement("button")}}, or null if this button is not owned by any form.

remarks.para:
-
-
-button
-HTML form attribute
-HTML forms guide

HTMLButtonElementFormAction.summary: The formAction property of the interface is the URL of the program that is executed on the server when the form that owns this control is submitted. It reflects the value of the <button>'s formaction attribute.

remarks.para: The value overrides the property of the interface if the form is submitted via the button. This property can be retrieved or set.

-
-
-
-
-Sending form data

HTMLButtonElementFormAction.value: A string. The URL for form submission.

HTMLButtonElementFormEnctype.summary: The formEnctype property of the interface is the {{Glossary("MIME_type", "MIME type")}} of the content sent to the server when the form is submitted. It reflects the value of the <button>'s formenctype attribute.

remarks.para: The value overrides the property of the interface if the form is submitted via the submit button. This property can be retrieved or set. If not set, the value is the empty string ("").

-
-
-
-
-
-Sending form data

HTMLButtonElementFormMethod.summary: The formMethod property of the interface is the {{Glossary("HTTP")}} method used to submit the {{HtmlElement("form")}} if the {{HTMLElement("button")}} element is the control that submits the form. It reflects the value of the <button>'s formmethod attribute.

remarks.para: The value overrides the property of the interface if the form is submitted via the button. This property can be retrieved or set. If set with an empty or invalid value, the invalid default value is "get". If not set at all, the value is the empty string ("").

-
-
-
-
-
-Sending form data

HTMLButtonElementFormNoValidate.summary: The formNoValidate property of the interface is a boolean value indicating if the {{htmlelement("form")}} will bypass constraint validation when submitted via the button. It reflects the <button> element's formnovalidate attribute.

remarks.para: Its value overrides the property of the interface if the form is submitted via the button. This property can be retrieved or set.

-
-
-
-
-
-
-form
-
-
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation

HTMLButtonElementFormTarget.summary: The formTarget property of the interface is the tab, window, or iframe where the response of the submitted {{HtmlElement("form")}} is to be displayed. It reflects the value of the {{HTMLElement("button")}} element's formtarget attribute.

remarks.para: The value overrides the property of the interface if the form is submitted via the button. This property can be retrieved or set. If not set, the value is the empty string ("").

-
-
-
-
-
-Sending form data

HTMLButtonElementLabels.summary:
The HTMLButtonElement.labels read-only property returns a
of the {{HTMLElement("label")}} elements associated with the
button element.
HTMLButtonElementLabels.value:
A containing the <label> elements associated
with the <button> element.

HTMLButtonElementName.summary: The name property of the interface indicates the name of the {{HTMLElement("button")}} element or the empty string if the element has no name. It reflects the element's name attribute.
HTMLButtonElementName.value: A string representing the element's name.

HTMLButtonElementPopoverTargetAction.summary: The popoverTargetAction property of the interface gets and sets the action to be performed ("hide", "show", or "toggle") on a popover element being controlled by a button.

remarks.para: It reflects the value of the popovertargetaction HTML attribute.
-Popover API

HTMLButtonElementPopoverTargetAction.value: An enumerated value. Possible values are:

HTMLButtonElementPopoverTargetElement.summary: The popoverTargetElement property of the interface gets and sets the popover element to control via a button.

remarks.para: It is the JavaScript equivalent of the popovertarget HTML attribute.
Establishing a relationship between a popover and its invoker button using the popoverTargetElement property has two additional useful effects:
-Popover API

HTMLButtonElementPopoverTargetElement.value: A reference to a popover element in the DOM.

HTMLButtonElementReportValidity.summary: The reportValidity() method of the interface performs the same validity checking steps as the method. In addition, if the event is not canceled, the browser displays the problem to the user.

remarks.para:
-
-button
-form
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
-CSS :valid and :invalid pseudo-classes

HTMLButtonElementReportValidity.returns: Returns true if the element's value has no validity problems; otherwise, returns false.

HTMLButtonElementSetCustomValidity.summary: The setCustomValidity() method of the interface sets the custom validity message for the {{htmlelement("button")}} element. Use the empty string to indicate that the element does not have a custom validity error.

remarks.para:
-button
-
-
-
-
-Form validation.
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
-CSS :valid and :invalid pseudo-classes

HTMLButtonElementType.summary: The type property of the interface is a string that indicates the behavior type of the {{HTMLElement("button")}} element.

remarks.para: It reflects the type attribute of the button element.

- property
- property

HTMLButtonElementType.value: A string representing the type.Its possible values are listed in the attribute's button types section.

HTMLButtonElementValidationMessage.summary: The validationMessage read-only property of the interface returns a string representing a localized message that describes the validation constraints that the {{htmlelement("button")}} control does not satisfy (if any). This is the empty string if the control is not a candidate for constraint validation (the <button>'s type is button or reset), or it satisfies its constraints.

remarks.para: If the <button> is a candidate for constraint validation (the type is set or defaults to submit and is true) and the constraints are not met (there is a non-null ), the value is the error message that would be shown to the user during element validation.

-button
-
-
-
-
-
-
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
-CSS :valid and :invalid pseudo-classes

HTMLButtonElementValidity.summary: The validity read-only property of the interface returns a object that represents the validity states this element is in.

remarks.para:
-
-button
-form
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation

HTMLButtonElementValue.summary: The value property of the interface represents the value of the {{htmlelement("button")}} element as a string, or the empty string if no value is set. It reflects the element's value attribute.

remarks.para:
-button
-
-

HTMLButtonElementValue.value: A string containing the value of the button element.

HTMLButtonElementWillValidate.summary: The willValidate read-only property of the interface indicates whether the {{htmlelement("button")}} element is a candidate for constraint validation. It is false if any conditions bar it from constraint validation, including:

remarks.para:
-
-button
-form
-Learn: Client-side form validation
-Guide: Constraint validation
